titleStmt.title: The pretended country squire, with an account of his last will and testament: together with a whole dicar of legacies bequeathed to his new-found friends; who at length, to their unspeakable sorrow, are left in the lurch. : To the tune of, Merry and Glad.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, and J. Back.,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: The National Library of Scotland.
